DESCRIPTION OF #2 — "CONVERSATIONS ABROAD" — INTERVIEW WITH YOUNG STUDENT
LEADERS OF FRENCH GROUP AT RAILWAY STATION AS THEY
PREPARE TO LEAVE FOR A VISIT TO AMERICAN HOMES FOR
THE SUMMER,
What the young men leaders hope to explore in their summer visit of their
three groups in American attitudes and understanding between American and
French people ("America is not all a factory and machine land..,,France is
not all Place Pigale,"). Each of the three French groups had in it, young
French students and students from Tunis, Morocco, and Algiers, thus making
it an opportiinity for the French group to learn more about the different
points of view separating them.,.they bring out explicitly that no one group
of people can surely have the "right" answer to solving world problems.
that the only hope lies in understanding the cultural, historic and political
background of each the "answers" offered as national or regional "solutions"
or points of view.also includes hopes and plans of the French groups'
experience in America....the possibility of studying "alcoholism", learning
more about each city and town.,..a possible visit to Miami etc.
